p.b: We are ready to release our plan of instruction for distant learning starting Monday, April 6th and ending Thursday, May 14th. This is a new area of instruction, where our students and teachers will learn new techniques and strategies to keep students engaged academically, while we are away from the traditional setting in the building. At least one teacher will be calling you on Monday to help with the transition. We are asking for you to also enter a new way of learning, since you will be vital to helping the students at home. It is our intent to offer you all of the support we can possibly give. Your teachers will give you their emails as well as a phone number to reach them to get the help needed.
You will be able to choose from three different types of instruction:
Using your own technology from home,
Using our wifi and one of our devices from your car in the school parking lot (we will give out the password as needed),
Packets sent home each Monday on the lunch routes via bus; packets will be returned on the bus Thursday.

Some of you have said that you need a device at home. Please call me or email me next week to set an appointment to pick up a chromebook at the school. Those using technology will be sent teacher lessons through a chosen platform by the teacher. We are using Google Classroom, Zoom, or an uploaded video to email (teachers will send links to help with these platforms as needed). It is very important for your students to be able to access their school email, or we can email the parent/guardian. When you talk to the teacher on Monday, you can specify which type of instruction you wish to have for the students. We prefer all students 3rd grade and younger use their parent’s email. Each student will have an assignment to complete. Please email that back to the teacher. You may also take a picture with your phone and upload the picture to the email. Teachers are not going to overload the students. We want them to have no more than one or two hours of work a day. If it is a packet, it will be picked up Monday on the bus route for lunch delivery. Please return the packet on the Thursday bus run.

Those students on Edgenuity, Mrs. Shoulders will be calling and giving you directions on how we are proceeding. I have contacted most of our senior parents or students. If you haven’t heard from one of us, please reach out. We may not have a correct phone number. Our TCC and Central Tech students are under the instruction of those institutions. They will need to follow those directions to finish out their classes. All special education parents will receive a call from the teacher for their student.

I know these are unprecedented times. The goal is to only help your students, not hinder them in any way. Do not stress over this; we are here to help. Through the means of technology, there are many ways to communicate. Please reach out to us with any questions. My information will be at the bottom. If you call the school, please leave a message on my extension. I will receive the message through email and get back to you as soon as possible. Remember, we are not to be in the buildings except for essential staff. Student items will be released at a later time when restrictions are lessened. If there is a concern, please let me know. I am sure there will be many questions and a few obstacles to overcome. The Olive Staff is here to help you every step of the way. Olive is a wonderful community, and I know we will get through this together. Hug your families and be thankful for each other. I encourage you to use this time to build some memories while we are all at home.

p.strong: New resource for students to report inappropriate behavior anonymously. Also, online lunch payments are now available. This is the letter that was sent home with students.

b.span: Starting today, our school is launching a resource to keep our school safer. Students and parents will be able to report anonymously, via a mobile app, any information that will help keep a positive and healthy school climate within Olive Public Schools. We are wanting to be proactive instead of reactive when dealing with inappropriate behavior. Grades
had an assembly on Friday introducing this new resource.
For our lower grades, we realize parents will need to guide their students more when using this resource. We encourage all parents to discuss the
app with their students. The app may be downloaded free of charge through Apple or Google Play. You will need to call the school for the appropriate site code:

Online payments for lunches are now available. You must have an email address on your student’s demographic page. If you do not have an email registered with the school, please contact the secretaries and provide them with an email address, so you can log on to your student’s account and make payments. If you have any questions, please contact Karla in the cafeteria.

p.strong: Thank you to the following donors who contributed to our Accelerated Reader program!!

div.p: Olive Public School Staff is "Highly Qualified." Parents have the right to request information from the office concerning the teaching credentials of staff.

span.b: Each recipient of a grant or sub grant under the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 6301 et seq.) must display, in a public place, the hotline contact information of the Office of Inspector General of the Department of Education so that any individual who observers, detects, or suspects improper use of taxpayer funds can easily report such improper use. ESSA, Section 9203(1) - 1 800 647-8733

div.p: Letterman jackets that were ordered are arriving each day. Your student will be notified when it is arrives.

a.aria-label: Read more about High School News

p.b: Game time for High School Football game at Prue has changed to 7:30 on October 17th.

h3.a: Exciting New Programs Coming to Olive Public Schools

div.p: We are excited to tell you about two new programs to start in the 2019-2020 school year. Olive Public Schools will now have an after school care for students at a minimal cost. This program will consist of tutoring, snack, and extra curricular activities to allow each child to benefit from this program. Certified staff will be leading this program, and it will be offered from 3:30 pm to 6 pm while school is in session.

The other program we are offering is a blended learning opportunity for students 6th-12th grades who need to approach school differently due to varying circumstances and still thrive in attaining their educational goals. Many students have chosen an online education route, but are not able to participate in the extracurricular activities that public schools have to offer. Some or all learning can be done from home, but certified staff will be available at the school for any help needed. Forms will be available for parents and students to fill out in order to guide their individual education route. Please email Joanna Lobaugh, Principal of Curriculum and Instruction, at jlobaugh@olive.k12.ok.us for more information on both of these programs.

a.aria-label: Read more about Exciting New Programs Coming to Olive Public Schools

div.p: Online Enrollment for returning students will open on Monday, August 5, 2019

All parents must have an email on TeacherEase for online enrollment. If you have not given the school your email, you may call the Superintendent's office and give your email after June 1, 2019. We will also have enrollment at the school for anyone new to the district and also if you need to use our computer lab to enroll on the following dates.
Monday, August 5, 2019 from 8 am to 4 pm
Tuesday, August 6, 2019 from 8 am to 7 pm
Wednesday, August 7, 2019 from 8 am to 4 pm
Please email jlobaugh@olive.k12.ok.us for any questions you might have or call the school.
Hope you have a great summer!
